Dr. OJ Akintande

Postdoctoral Researcher

Olalekan Joseph Akintande, Ph.D.

Postdoctoral Researcher, Department of Applied Mathematics and Computer Science
Technical University of Denmark (DTU Compute)

Google Scholar Scopus Web of Science

About Me

Dr. Olalekan Joseph Akintande is a statistician and researcher specializing in Machine Learning, Computational Statistics, and Statistical Learning. With a PhD in Computational Statistics from the University of Ibadan, Nigeria, he currently serves as a Postdoctoral Researcher at DTU Compute, focusing on responsible AI, algorithmic fairness, and data-driven solutions for healthcare and global challenges. Cited over 550 times, his work bridges interdisciplinary applications in energy economics, public health, climate science, and AI ethics.

Education
  • PhD, Computational Statistics - University of Ibadan
  • MSc, Statistics - University of Ibadan
  • BSc, Statistics - University of Ibadan
  • Dip., Mathematics & Statistics - Yaba College of Technology
Experience
  • Postdoc, DTU Compute (2024–Present)
  • Lecturer/Researcher, University of Ibadan (Remotely)
  • Microsoft PhD Research Fellow (2021–2022)

Research Areas

Research Interests

My research focuses on the intersection of statistics, machine learning, and computational methods to solve complex real-world problems.

Key Research Areas:
  • Machine Learning and Statistical Learning
  • Computational Statistics
  • Responsible AI and Algorithmic Fairness
  • Energy Economics Modeling
  • Healthcare Data Analytics
  • Climate Science Applications
Current Projects:
  • Developing fair machine learning algorithms for healthcare applications
  • Statistical modeling of renewable energy systems
  • AI ethics and explainable AI methods
Research Profile

My work bridges theoretical statistics with practical applications across multiple domains.
